channel.title: Projects on Portfolio website of Jules Noël
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Portfolio website of Jules Noël

item.title: Session 2: Homework 1
item.description: Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits? # Loading the data library(fivethirtyeight) data(drinks) We’ll check first for any missing variable. Fortunately, our dataset is complete and we have no missing values. # Using glimpse and skim to understand the dataframe glimpse(drinks) ## Rows: 193 ## Columns: 5 ## $ country <chr> "Afghanistan", "Albania", "Algeria", "... ## $ beer_servings <int> 0, 89, 25, 245, 217, 102, 193, 21, 261.

item.title: Session 4: Homework 2
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies Beforehand, we downloaded a data set on weather anomalies in the past. We will make some modifications to it and analyze it. Let’s start by selecting the months from January to December and drop the “periods” variables. tidyweather<- weather %>% select(Year,Jan:Dec) %>% pivot_longer(2:13, names_to="month", values_to = "delta") Our tidyweather data frame has now three variables now, one each for year, month, and delta, or temperature deviation.

item.title: Session 6: Homework 3
item.description: Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance We want to explore some statistics to analyze health patterns from the CDC. Every two years, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention conduct the Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System (YRBSS) survey, where it takes data from high schoolers (9th through 12th grade), to analyze health patterns. data(yrbss) glimpse(yrbss) ## Rows: 13,583 ## Columns: 13 ## $ age <int> 14, 14, 15, 15, 15, 15, 15, 14, 15, 15, 15.

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Watching List Nowadays I don’t really have the time to watch movies. My courses at London Business School are taking most of my time and the rest of my days are dedicated to my applications to Investment Banks for a summer analyst position. So I thought, why not already compile a list of movies to watch once the exams are behind me and my internship found. In order to construct such list, I am going to explore the data movies used during our first assignment in Data Analytics in Finance.
